message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CR 

This paper presents a new approach to instance segmentation in images, which is a task commonly studied in computer vision (cs.CV) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) research. The approach involves assigning categories to each pixel within an instance based on its location and size, which can be viewed as a classification problem. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to research in machine learning (cs.LG) and natural language processing (cs.CL), as well as computer security (cs.CR) due to the potential applications of instance segmentation in security-related tasks such as object detection in surveillance footage.
